short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Checks if the marked number is a timestamp and shows a tooltip with the current date time.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Timestamp Checker is a powerful and user-friendly Chrome extension designed to help you validate and convert timestamps effortlessly. Whether you encounter timestamps in Unix Epoch format or any other representation, this extension makes it easy to confirm their accuracy and convert them to the corresponding date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Key Features:

Validate Timestamps: Select any timestamp on a web page, and the extension will automatically verify its validity. No more second-guessing if a number is indeed a timestamp!

Convert to UTC: Once a timestamp is validated, Timestamp Checker instantly converts it to the exact date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Say goodbye to manual conversions!

Seamless Integration: Timestamp Checker seamlessly integrates into your browsing experience. Simply mark a timestamp, click the extension icon, and enter the timestamp in the popup to unveil its UTC equivalent.

User-Friendly Interface: With an intuitive interface, Timestamp Checker is easy to use for both beginners and experienced users. Get accurate results in a matter of seconds!

How to Use:

Mark any potential timestamp on any web page.
Click the Timestamp Checker extension icon in the browser toolbar.
Enter the timestamp in the popup window and click "Check."
Witness the magic as the extension instantly confirms its validity and displays the corresponding date and time in UTC.
Timestamp Checker is your go-to tool for working with timestamps, providing reliable results in a blink of an eye. Empower yourself with precision and efficiencyâ€”add Timestamp Checker to your Chrome browser today!

Note: Timestamps are commonly represented as the number of seconds since January 1, 1970 (Unix Epoch time) in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
